_comment: Test Metadata Configuration - UJ Student Portal Stress Test Nov 2024

test_metadata.client_name: University of Johannesburg - UJ Student Portal

test_purpose.primary_objective: Pre-production validation before peak registration period — validate system readiness to handle 250 concurrent students during the live registration window
test_purpose.business_context: The University of Johannesburg runs an annual student registration cycle that experiences extreme peak loads. This stress test validates that the UJ Student Portal can sustain performance under maximum expected concurrent user load before the registration window opens.
test_purpose.success_criteria: All transactions meet SLA thresholds (P95 < 3000ms, Error Rate < 1%) under 250 concurrent virtual users

Registration_New - 2024.description: Full student registration workflow covering login, POPIA consent, personal contact details, address validation, contact persons, proforma statement, document submission, registration verification, payment rules, online payment, academic rules, subject selection, and registration acceptance

test_configuration.ramp_up_strategy: Start with 2 users, add 4 users every 15 seconds to a maximum of 250 users
test_configuration.peak_load_timing: Peak of 250 users reached approximately 15 minutes into the test (12:39 PM)
test_configuration.load_profile_description: Gradual ramp-up to simulate realistic user growth during peak student registration period

sla_thresholds.notes: Industry-standard SLA thresholds for web applications

infrastructure.notes: No application server infrastructure monitoring configured for this test run

environmental_factors: Test conducted with think time of 10,000ms between page interactions to simulate realistic user behaviour
constraints: Load generator and controller running on same machine (localhost)
anomalies: 291 assertion failures concentrated in Subject Selection and Submit Registration steps — likely due to dynamic data validation responses
Registration Verification step consistently slow (Avg 5.62s) — this is a known query-intensive operation
